version_description: We improved the performance of Cisco Spark.
We improved the performance of Cisco Spark.
We improved the performance of Cisco Spark.

* When you choose Leave & Answer from the call waiting list, Cisco Spark will answer the second call.
* Getting another call won’t interrupt the audio of your current call.
* You can now reliably unmute yourself during a call.

* When you choose Leave & Answer from the call waiting list, Cisco Spark will answer the second call.
* Getting another call won’t interrupt the audio of your current call.
* You can now reliably unmute yourself during a call.

We improved the performance of Cisco Spark.
We improved the performance of Cisco Spark.
We improved the performance of Cisco Spark.

We no longer support iOS 9. Please update to iOS 10.0 or later to continue using Cisco Spark.

New Feature:
• Now, you can swipe right on a space to mark all new messages as read without opening the space.

Resolved Issues:
• We fixed an issue where the meetings list didn’t show your meetings even after you gave Cisco Spark permission to access your calendar.
• We solved an issue that caused the back button to disappear during the initial set up for Cisco Spark.
• We improved the speed of joining calls when there’s a lot of activity in the Cisco Spark app.

We no longer support iOS 9. Please update to iOS 10.0 or later to continue using Cisco Spark.

New Feature:
• Now, you can swipe right on a space to mark all new messages as read without opening the space.

Resolved Issues:
• We fixed an issue where the meetings list didn’t show your meetings even after you gave Cisco Spark permission to access your calendar.
• We solved an issue that caused the back button to disappear during the initial set up for Cisco Spark.
• We improved the speed of joining calls when there’s a lot of activity in the Cisco Spark app.

We no longer support iOS 9. Please update to iOS 10.0 or later to continue using Cisco Spark.

New Feature:
• Now, you can swipe right on a space to mark all new messages as read without opening the space.

Resolved Issues:
• We fixed an issue where the meetings list didn’t show your meetings even after you gave Cisco Spark permission to access your calendar.
• We solved an issue that caused the back button to disappear during the initial set up for Cisco Spark.
• We improved the speed of joining calls when there’s a lot of activity in the Cisco Spark app.

- We improved the speed of sending messages.
- We fixed an issue that could lead to missed notifications when you’re added to a new space.
- We fixed an issue that caused notifications to remain on the lock screen after reading a space.
- We improved stability when joining calls or meetings.

- We improved the speed of sending messages.
- We fixed an issue that could lead to missed notifications when you’re added to a new space.
- We fixed an issue that caused notifications to remain on the lock screen after reading a space.
- We improved stability when joining calls or meetings.

- We improved the speed of sending messages.
- We fixed an issue that could lead to missed notifications when you’re added to a new space.
- We fixed an issue that caused notifications to remain on the lock screen after reading a space.
- We improved stability when joining calls or meetings.

New Features:
We added support for Drag and Drop on iPad for iOS 11.
We improved the layout of Cisco Spark on an iPhone X.

Resolved Issues:
We fixed an issue which would cause a room system to unmute when when left the call from a paired iOS device.
We fixed a crash that could occur when trying to share a file for the first time in Spark.

New Features:
We added support for Drag and Drop on iPad for iOS 11.
We improved the layout of Cisco Spark on an iPhone X.

Resolved Issues:
We fixed an issue which would cause a room system to unmute when when left the call from a paired iOS device.
We fixed a crash that could occur when trying to share a file for the first time in Spark.

New Features:
We added support for Drag and Drop on iPad for iOS 11.
We improved the layout of Cisco Spark on an iPhone X.

Resolved Issues:
We fixed an issue which would cause a room system to unmute when when left the call from a paired iOS device.
We fixed a crash that could occur when trying to share a file for the first time in Spark.

• We solved an issue that prevented you from joining Cisco WebEx Personal Room meetings from Cisco Spark.
• We improved the stability of muting audio when you join, leave, or re-join a meeting.
• We fixed an issue that caused the Cisco Spark app to quit unexpectedly.

• We improved the stability of muting audio when you join, leave, or re-join a meeting.
• We fixed an issue that caused the Cisco Spark app to quit unexpectedly.

• We fixed an issue that caused sent files to appear as missing or empty.
• We solved an issue that caused Cisco Spark to close abruptly after taking a long time to open.

• We fixed an issue that caused sent files to appear as missing or empty.

We now support screen sharing while you are on a call, there is also a tutorial showing you how to set it up.
We now support screen sharing while you are on a call, there is also a tutorial showing you how to set it up.
We now support screen sharing while you are on a call, there is also a tutorial showing you how to set it up.
We solved an issue that caused you to lose audio during a call.
We solved an issue that caused you to lose audio during a call.
We solved an issue that caused you to lose audio during a call.

We made these improvements:
• We’ve changed the way you use Search and Filters. You’ll see your filters when you click the search bar.

We’ve resolved these issues:
- Video calls on Cisco Spark lost audio when you switched between them and an incoming cellular call.
- After restarting your iPhone or iPad, Cisco Spark would sign you out of the app or remove you from spaces. This usually only happened if received a new push notification before unlocking the device.
- If your email address contained special characters, such as apostrophes, you weren’t able to sign into the app.

We made these improvements:
- Line breaks are rendered consistently between the iOS and desktop apps so that your messages display similarly across the apps.

We made these improvements:
• We’ve changed the way you use Search and Filters. You’ll see your filters when you click the search bar.

- If your email address contained special characters, such as apostrophes, you weren’t able to sign into the app.

We made these improvements:
- Line breaks are rendered consistently between the iOS and desktop apps so that your messages display similarly across the apps.

We’ve resolved these issues:
- Video calls on Cisco Spark lost audio when you switched between them and an incoming cellular call.
- After restarting your iPhone or iPad, Cisco Spark would sign you out of the app or remove you from spaces. This usually only happened if received a new push notification before unlocking the device.
- If your email address contained special characters, such as apostrophes, you weren’t able to sign into the app.

We made these improvements:
- Line breaks are rendered consistently between the iOS and desktop apps so that your messages display similarly across the apps.
Stability Improvements
Stability Improvements
Stability Improvements

We added support for a new feature:
• You can now choose how you want to view web links. Go to Me > Advanced > Open Web Links in Safari to view them in Safari instead of Cisco Spark. For more information, see https://collaborationhelp.cisco.com/article/en-us/996i2r

We resolved these issues:
• Calls dropped when you switched from Wi-Fi to an LTE cellular network.

We made these improvements:
• We added an expiration time for content that you copied from the app.
• We no longer ask for feedback about call quality after every meeting. You can still send feedback through the app by choosing “Submit Feedback.”

We added support for a new feature:
• You can now choose how you want to view web links. Go to Me > Advanced > Open Web Links in Safari to view them in Safari instead of Cisco Spark. For more information, see https://collaborationhelp.cisco.com/article/en-us/996i2r

• We no longer ask for feedback about call quality after every meeting. You can still send feedback through the app by choosing “Submit Feedback.”

We resolved these issues:
• Calls dropped when you switched from Wi-Fi to an LTE cellular network.

We made these improvements:
• We added an expiration time for content that you copied from the app.
• We no longer ask for feedback about call quality after every meeting. You can still send feedback through the app by choosing “Submit Feedback.”

We resolved these issues:
• It took a while for your profile picture to update in the app after you uploaded a new photo.
• If you scheduled a meeting, two Join buttons appeared in your Spaces list when it was time to join the meeting.
• After moving a call from your phone to a room or desk device, you could still hear the call on your phone.
• If you moved a call from a room or desk device to your phone, you couldn’t mute the audio on your phone.
• The app would freeze during a call if you were using iPad Multitasking.
• You couldn't post images or videos to a space if you didn't give Photos access to Cisco Spark.

Stability Improvements

Cisco Spark is now Cisco Webex Teams!

We made these improvements:
• Blue dots only appear for unread spaces that match your notification settings. You can refine your focus even more by using the new Notifications filter. The number of unread spaces that appear on the app icon will match the Notifications filter. For more information, see Tips for Managing Notifications in Cisco Webex Teams.

We resolved these issues:
• Sometimes, iOS Calendar caused meeting addresses to be invalid.
• You couldn't share your screen from some versions of iOS 11.

Cisco Spark is now Cisco Webex Teams!

Cisco Spark is now Cisco Webex Teams!

We made these improvements:
• Blue dots only appear for unread spaces that match your notification settings. You can refine your focus even more by using the new Notifications filter. The number of unread spaces that appear on the app icon will match the Notifications filter. For more information, see Tips for Managing Notifications in Cisco Webex Teams.

We resolved these issues:
• Sometimes, iOS Calendar caused meeting addresses to be invalid.
• You couldn't share your screen from some versions of iOS 11.

We made these improvements:
• To make it easier to activate a new account, we added a link that opens your default email app when you sign up for Cisco Webex Teams.

We resolved these issues:
• People using Webex Teams with Hybrid Call Service Connect received incoming calls with “Unknown” as the caller ID. Now, the caller’s name displays correctly.

We made these improvements:
• To make it easier to activate a new account, we added a link that opens your default email app when you sign up for Cisco Webex Teams.

We resolved these issues:
• People using Webex Teams with Hybrid Call Service Connect received incoming calls with “Unknown” as the caller ID. Now, the caller’s name displays correctly.

We made these improvements:
• To make it easier to activate a new account, we added a link that opens your default email app when you sign up for Cisco Webex Teams.

We resolved these issues:
• People using Webex Teams with Hybrid Call Service Connect received incoming calls with “Unknown” as the caller ID. Now, the caller’s name displays correctly.

We made the following improvements:
• We updated the format and color scheme of the spaces list. The new format emphasizes space and team names and doesn’t preview messages.
• Now, you’ll find your Do Not Disturb status settings when you click your profile picture.
• For meetings with video, you now see the active speaker and shared presentation at the same time.
• We reduced the audio delay after reconnecting to meetings when you have low connectivity.
• We changed how audio is processed when ultrasound discovery is turned off to improve sound quality.

We resolved these issues:
• The call notification would continue to ring on your iPhone or iPad after you joined from a different device.

We made these improvements:
• Messaging now supports animated GIFs, provided by GIPHY. Your administrator can disable them for your organization using Webex Control Hub.
• We added new whiteboard colors and an Undo feature to remove errant strokes.
• You can now automatically connect with Webex devices.
• You can now share your presentation locally to a room or desk device without starting a call.

We resolved these issues:
• You couldn’t adhere to your organization’s retention policy if you had spaces with more than 10 other organizations.
• If your organization’s retention policy removed all content from a space, that space appeared incorrectly in your spaces list.
• iOS universal links did not open correctly on iPad.

We made these improvements:
• You can now join a meeting or call without sharing your video.
• Now, when you send messages containing URLs for websites, you’ll automatically get a preview of the website.
• You can now choose high contrast settings so that it’s easier to view text and icons in the app.

• Sometimes, the app would quit unexpectedly when you clicked from one space to another.

We made this improvement:
• Webex Teams now supports VoiceOver.
• We updated the indicator for when you're added to a space.
• If your company requires you to set a PIN to lock the screen, you're now required to immediately set one before using Webex Teams.

We resolved these issues:
• The call notification continued to ring on your iPhone or iPad after you answered when using Cisco Webex Hybrid Call Service.
• The file path appeared in spaces when you shared pictures from one space to another.

We made these improvements:
• If your administrator enables Cisco Webex Hybrid Calendar Service, you'll now be able to add your work calendar directly to the Webex Teams app.
• We added support for Webex Share. With the Webex Share device, in addition to local wireless screen share, you'll be able to join a meeting, share your screen & control the device. Audio for the meeting plays on your mobile device.
• When you join a meeting from Webex Teams, you'll be able to join by phone using Call Me and Call In after you've joined the meeting.
We resolved this issue:
• The text in the Advanced settings displayed incorrectly.

• We added support for Webex Share. With the Webex Share device, in addition to local wireless screen share, you'll be able to join a meeting, share your screen & control the device. Audio for the meeting plays on your mobile device.
• When you join a meeting from Webex Teams, you'll be able to join by phone using Call Me and Call In after you've joined the meeting.

We resolved these issues:
• When joining or starting Cisco Webex Personal Room meetings, your iPhone or iPad quit unexpectedly.
• When joining a meeting using the call-in numbers, your call connected with video even when you choose to connect with audio only.

We made these improvements:
• If you enter 999 for an emergency call, Webex Teams routes the call to your to your mobile service to complete the call.

We resolved this issue:
• You didn't get notifications for calls placed directly to you if the app wasn't in the foreground.

We made these improvements:
• When you join a meeting from Webex Teams, you'll see changes to the in-meeting controls to align more closely with Webex Meetings. Also, the video icon turns blue now when video is turned on.
• We've made it easier to mark spaces as favorites. Instead of going to the space settings, you'll be able to just click a star near the space's title.
• You can now automatically connect to on-premises Webex Devices within the same Wi-Fi network. After you connect, you can wirelessly share content with other people in the same room.
• If enabled for your organization, you can work with Microsoft OneDrive and SharePoint Online files directly from the Webex Teams app.

We made these improvements:
• When you join a meeting from Webex Teams, you'll see changes to the in-meeting controls to align more closely with Webex Meetings. Also, the video icon turns blue now when video is turned on.
• We've made it easier to mark spaces as favorites. Instead of going to the space settings, you'll be able to just click a star near the space's title.
• You can now automatically connect to on-premises Webex Devices within the same Wi-Fi network. After you connect, you can wirelessly share content with other people in the same room.
• If enabled for your organization, you can work with Microsoft OneDrive and SharePoint Online files directly from the Webex Teams app.

• If enabled for your organization, you can work with Microsoft OneDrive and SharePoint Online files directly from the Webex Teams app.

We made these improvements:
• You can now tell what files originate from OneDrive or SharePoint Online.
• You now have a set of options when previewing files from OneDrive or SharePoint Online: Copy Share Link, Refresh, Open in OneDrive

We made these improvements:
• We’ve made it more obvious when you’re calling someone or meeting with a group. In spaces between just two people, you’ll still see Call. But, when you’re in a space with three or more people you’ll see Meet.
• When you join a meeting from Webex Teams using Webex Share, you’ll be able to join using Call Me and Call In after you’ve joined the meeting.
• We’ve updated the icon used for teams.
• After you search, you’ll now be able to call people directly from the search results.
• We’ve improved the way you connect to your Microsoft OneDrive or SharePoint Online account, and you can follow the instructions in the app to get it set up.

• We’ve improved the way you connect to your Microsoft OneDrive or SharePoint Online account, and you can follow the instructions in the app to get it set up.

We made this improvement:
• When you make a call from Webex Teams, you'll be able to launch another calling application to make calls so you can leverage the calling capabilities available in the other app.

We made these improvements:
• We updated the text in the space policy to say "Content is stored for up to (duration)."
• We added a recording indicator to show when local recording is started for a meeting from Webex Teams on Windows or Mac.

We made these improvements:
• We changed the name of the Meetings icon to Schedule. The icon itself hasn't changed.
• We changed the Meet icon for spaces with three or more people, but we haven't changed the name.

We've added these features:
• We added a setting to let you reduce the image sizes so you can limit your data usage when connected over your cellular service rather than Wi-Fi.
• We've brought back the ability to join a meeting using the Call In and Call Me options.
• We've made a few improvements to help you navigate to active threads and to make replies stand out more in the spaces.

We resolved these issues:
• We resolve an issue that prevented the app from connecting to the network when your device was set up to use proxy auto-configuration (PAC).

We made these improvements:
• We added the banner back to the spaces list to let you know when the messages were catching up or that you lost network connectivity.
• We brought back your ability to mark all your unread messages as read.

We've added these features:
• You can now share your screen in a meeting and wirelessly to Webex devices.
• After you've been using Webex Teams for a while, you might be asked to let us know how likely you are to recommend it to someone else.

We resolved these issues:
• When you were navigating from your spaces list to your messages, the screen would flicker.
• We've added the ability to send logs and submit feedback.
• We've made some improvements to the default font size so text is clearer.
• You can now edit or update your profile picture.

We've added these features:
• You can open a space from the Webex Teams mobile app on a Webex Board.

We made these improvements:
• Draft messages now support @mentions.
• The mobile app keyboard now supports light and dark theme.
• We've added the ability to send logs.
• We've reintroduced the arrow that lets you scroll to the latest message in a space.
• When you join a Webex Meeting that has no video URL, Webex Teams launches the Webex Meetings app to join the meeting.

We resolved these issues:
• When sharing your screen wirelessly to a Webex board there was a delay in updating content.
• When both the new reply and new messages buttons were present in a space they would overlap.
• Sometimes you couldn't see when a message had been edited.
• We've disabled horizontal scrolling on iPad.
• When you use Dynamic Type to select your preferred font size, the @mention font will also be adjusted.

• You can open a space from the Webex Teams mobile app on a Webex Board.
